clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Comprehensive Intervention on Blood Pressure Control in a Primary Care Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Comprehensive Intervention on Blood Pressure Control in a Primary Care Setting

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

clinical_study.source: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

brief_summary.textblock: The implementation of lifestyle modifications, home blood pressure (BP) measurement, and optimization of antihypertensive drug therapy have been shown to improve BP control in tightly controlled research settings. The investigators objective is to determine the effect of these interventions in a primary care setting, with the family practitioners and nurses serving as the interventionists. The investigaotrs hypothesis is that a comprehensive intervention performed in a primary care setting would lead to better blood pressure control.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Office Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure

arm_group.description: Patients in this arm received a comprehensive intervention on hypertension through optimization of drug therapy, introduction of home blood pressure monitoring, and lifestyle guidance.
Patients randomized in this group did not receive any intervention and treatment continued according to conventional practice.

intervention.description: Comprehensive intervention on hypertension through optimization of drug therapy, introduction of home blood pressure monitoring, and lifestyle guidance
